name: Shangri-La's Rasa Sentosa Resort & Spa, Singapore

reviews.title: Quite nice, but not quite 5 star.
reviews.text: Just back from a trip to Asia, started in Singapore with two nights in the Oriental. Outstanding service, food everything was great. We had two days to kill so booked into the shangri la sentosa. We have stayed in the Shangri la Macatan in cebu last year it was an incredible couple of days and were looking forward to the sentosa.
There was no comparisson. The sentosa is getting quite tired by modern standards. Dont get me wrong it was ok but just nothing special and could do with a bit of a face lift.
reviews.title: worth the trip
Mixed re: Shangri La
reviews.text: If you have kids they would love the pool.
Food was disapointing as well, at lunch time round the pool if it was not fried, forget it!!!
reviews.title: Stay here if you feel you have to...otherwise...
Nice hotel with lovely views
reviews.text: Just stayed at the Shangri-La for 2 nights on Sentosa. Took the option of upgrading to a pool/ocean view room which is well worth the S$20 a night. Hillview rooms don't have a balcony and the view to the ocean over the pool was lovely. The hotel is getting dated now, like a lot of hotels, but still very clean and great pool area and facilities. Prices for food were reasonable, considering you're limited to where you can eat on Sentosa.

Really enjoyed Sentosa after 4 nights in Singapore. Plenty to do, or you can do nothing and just lie on the beach. Would recommend staying during the week, the Sunday was pretty hectic with day-trippers, but come Monday you could have shot a cannon in the place.
reviews.title: Major renovations needed !!

reviews.text: Would definitely come back to Sentosa and stay at the Shangri-La.
reviews.title: Even tho room wasn't much, thoroughly enjoyed stay

reviews.text: The Sentosa Resort is a great stopover hotel if you’re doing the long haul flight from Europe or England to Australia. It’s just the place to unwind and soak up the humidity by the poolside; it’s also a fabulous place if you have young children as there are heaps of activities for them.
reviews.title: The Worst 5 star hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is fabulous for exploring the island (which in my opinion takes more than 1 day if you do a visit from the mainland-so much to do!). The rooms are comfortable, and the balconies are great! We like to have a rainforest view and watch out for wildlife. The pool area is lovely, but there are too many towels left on the lounges (by selfish guests)which sometimes makes it difficult to find a place to sit. The staff are very polite but the front desk check in/out staff are quite slow. All in all, a great place to stay for a couple of days away from the mainland.
reviews.title: good for realaxing
The Best in Singapore
reviews.text: We first stayed at the Shangri La Rasa Sentosa 4 years ago - after research on the Singapore Website.

reviews.title: A game of Two halves
reviews.text: As we stayed for 10 nights we wanted something with a 'resort location' as well as proximity to shopping.

This is a fantastic property. Sentosa Island is just 10 minutes by cab from downtown Singapore, (40mins from the airport) via a short causeway to this 'island suburb'. We returned this year for another 8 nights - yes we do enjoy longer stays! But even a 2 or 3 night stopover en route to Europe would be still worth it.There are other hotels on the island but we think this offers the best value and location.
reviews.title: Great for families

reviews.text: The hotel is approximately 10 years old and well maintained. It is 14 stories and over looks the pool and then over to a man made beach and great views of the harbour (a base for many cruise liners) and commercial traffic.
reviews.title: Could be better!

aka: Shangri-La`s Rasa Sentosa Hotel Sentosa Island
description: Shangri-La's Rasa Sentosa Resort, Singapore’s only beachfront resort, is situated at Sentosa Island. Far from the hustle and bustle of the city, yet close to major attractions like Orchard Road, Little India and Clarke Quay, the resort is conveniently linked to mainland Singapore by a causeway. It is next to numerous attractions including the Universal Studios, Underwater World and Dolphin Lagoon. The business district is a mere 15 minutes away by car.
